definition: senior/of a senior generation/to honor/to respect/honorific/classifier for cannons and statues/ancient wine vessel

sentences.english: Worshiping the true God is only way to be blessed.
sentences.chinese: 只有尊崇独一的真神才会蒙福。

sentences.english: Et tibi redetur votum in Jerusalem.
The emperor4, Shah Jahan, built the Taj Mahal to honor his wife.
sentences.chinese: 沙迦汗王建造了泰姬玛哈陵来尊崇他的妻子。

sentences.english: The imperial furniture, the supreme life venerates enjoys.
sentences.chinese: 皇家家具，至尊生活的尊崇享受。

sentences.english: The king, who has reigned for six decades, is widely revered.
sentences.chinese: 广受尊崇的普密蓬国王已经在位六十余年。

sentences.english: The older person is very prestige, be respected.
sentences.chinese: 上了年岁的人很有声威，遭到尊崇。

sentences.english: Let them exalt him in the assembly of the people and praise him in the council of the elders.
sentences.chinese: 愿他们在民的会中尊崇他，在长老的位上赞美他。

sentences.english: And increased his sense of self-importance .
sentences.chinese: 也提升了他的妄自尊崇。

sentences.english: Thus, purple is worshiped by Taoists.
sentences.chinese: 因此，紫色被道士们所尊崇。

sentences.english: We deify independence and wilfulness and call them by the wrong name.
sentences.chinese: 我们尊崇独立固执，给它们错误的称号。

sentences.english: From historical documents we learn that the Shang nationality worshiped maternity.
sentences.chinese: 从传世文献记载的商族起源来看，商族尊崇母性。

sentences.english: In Germany, people honored the pagan god Oden during the mid-winter holiday.
sentences.chinese: 在德国，中冬时节人们尊崇非基督教神奥登。

sentences.english: And the death of this friend would sanctify his crime.
sentences.chinese: 而这位朋友的死尊崇着这他的罪行。

sentences.english: From then on, Huihe people began the long history of respecting Manichaeism, which lasted for hundreds of years.
sentences.chinese: 由此开始了回纥历史上长达数百年的摩尼教尊崇时期。

sentences.english: Tithing is an act of worship.
sentences.chinese: 十一奉献是尊崇神的行为表现。

definition: to admire/to revere/to look up to
to love and respect/love and respect
to believe in (a deity or other supernatural being)/to worship

pinyin: shen2 sheng4 bu4 ke3 qin1 fan4
